page.title: 08FACCOMBE AND NETHERTON
page.content: Faccombe pond, lost for many years and feared because of the ghost of a carriage that was supposed to have driven into it one dark night, is now an area of natural beauty supporting water and marsh flora and many birds. When the pond was cleared and cleaned a cart axle and wheel were found in the mud at the bottom. Netherton old Rectory, now a private house was decorated in the 17th century by Inigo Jones. At the back of the house is a painted window of a Regency gentleman sitting and reading. Harry Plunkett Greene sang here at Festivals. Tracks and paths running through woods and alongside fields are still re-made and repaired using materials from the old chalk and gravel pits on the Faccombe Estate.
